flawed_nl_solution:
If one egg weighs 1/16 of a pound then 1 pound will be made up of 1/(1/16) = 61 eggs
One pound of eggs is 61 eggs so 6 pounds is 6*61 = <<6*61=366>>366 eggs
One dozen is 12 eggs so 366 eggs will make 366/12 = <<366/12=30.5>>30.5 dozens

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 16, not 61. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
